item.description: I am a Robotics PhD candidate at the University of Utah. More information here.

item.title: Local Reactive Collision Avoidance for holonomic mobile robots
item.description:
Artificial Potential Fields

Implemented artificial potential field method of collision avoidance on a Holonomic mobile robot with a LIDAR for sensing. Explored methods to counter the drawbacks of potential field especially the narrow corridor oscillation effect. Simulation of the robot and environment was done in Vrep and the method was also tested on a real robot.

Optic Flow

Optic flow as a method to detect objects closer to the camera was investigated as a method of collision avoidance on a Holonomic mobile robot.With the environment static, the robot was mobile and closer objects tend to have larger optic flow and this was used to avoid obstacles. SIFT was used to detect good features in the environment with a wide angle camera.

Vector Polar Histogram

item.title: Mapping using only laser range finder on Mobile Robot
item.description:
The scope of my Bachelors thesis work was to examine the alternatives to using wheel encoders, which can still remain equivalent to the existing mapping procedures in terms of accuracy and computational efforts.

Objective:

The main objective of this project was to generate odometric readings from LRF data and remove the usage of wheel encoders(which tend to be error prone) for odometry.
